results.title: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed to establish cordial relations between Australians and migrants from Europe. Two Australian who criticise the newcomers’ lack of English find themselves in serious difficulties when magically transported to a foreign country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Forward communications
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Stresses that Australia’s vast distances make an efficient system of communication most essential. Shows how the Post Office is maintaining our present communications system at a high level of efficiency and also how the heavy post-war demand for new telephones and exchanges is being met.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Depending on weather
results.brief_description: A driver’s safety depends on the reliability of their car and on their knowledge and experience. As winter approaches racing driver David Mackay checks his car’s reliability to face all weather conditions.

results.title: Defensive riding techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Defensive riding is avoiding accidents by foreseeing possible dangers and taking appropriate action. Gives three short rules: firstly, try to anticipate and, therefore, avoid mistakes of other motorists; secondly, drive defensively, and heed all traffic rules and signals; thirdly, make sure you can be seen at all times.

results.title: Dear mum
results.creator_credit: Don Marley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining and at times funny film about the life of a young soldier in the army. He writes to tell his mum all the great things that happen in the army - like seeing the country; friendship; a lot of spare time and the satisfaction from working as a group.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Marley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cinesound Movietone

results.title: Darwin: doorway to Australia
results.brief_description: Life in Darwin, first port of call for air travellers en route from Europe to Sydney. Typical life in the city is shown, commerce, public administration, problems arising from its isolation, plans to improve the city with town planning and housing schemes to replace the shanty towns of the pre-war era. The film concludes with a corroboree danced by aboriginal tribes at an annual gathering in the Darwin Botanical Gardens.

results.title: Cyclone Tracy
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: At Christmas 1974, Darwin was hit by Cyclone Tracy, which left a train of almost inconceivable destruction. This film shows the damage wrought, and people’s reactions during and after the cyclone.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Noonan, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia

results.title: Cyclone approaching
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Indicates the counter-disaster operations initiated by the civil defence organizations and the simple safety procedures which should be followed by the community in general. Uses Cyclone Tracy as an example and includes graphic scenes depicting the type of devastation that cyclones can produce.

results.title: Cupid's complaint
results.creator_credit: Australian Road Safety Council and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A rather solidly-built Cupid complains to his mother that he had picked out a beautifully matched couple and was bringing them together, but now, as a result of the girl not giving hand signals and the young man speeding, they have crashed into one another’s cars and are furious with each other.

results.title: The Cross road crash
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Indicates that crossroads are one of the most likely places to have a collision. Lists the type of crossroads and discusses the avoidance of situations leading to accidents. Suitable for upper secondary level.
